alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 11:28AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY AROUND BETHEL ALONG BROWNS SLOUGH... * WHAT...Flooding caused by elevated water levels due to a previous ice jam. * WHERE...Including the Browns Slough along the Kuskokwim River in Bethel. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Businesses along Hangar Lake Road may experience minor flooding. Water over roadways is likely along with water ponding in poor drainage areas. Tidal influences may exacerbate flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1121 AM AKDT, The River Watch Team reports no more ice in the river. River levels will slowly drop as tundra drains. - For Kuskokwim River at Bethel: At 11:00am the stage was 8.4 feet. Flood Stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live or work along Browns Slough, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
